metadata.description: UI configuration for the EU AI Act Compliance Checker

app_config.title: EU AI Act Compliance Checker
app_config.description: Determine your obligations under the EU Artificial Intelligence Act
app_config.source: Based on official EU compliance checker
app_config.disclaimer: This tool provides guidance only. Consult legal professionals for compliance decisions.

prohibited.description: This AI practice is forbidden under the AI Act

high_risk.description: Strict obligations and conformity assessment required

out_of_scope.description: Not covered by the AI Act

help_text.Q1: An AI model is the algorithmic component (e.g., a neural network). An AI system includes the model plus its deployment context (data, hardware, interfaces).
help_text.QGPAI_1: A general-purpose AI model (GPAI) can perform a wide variety of tasks without being specifically designed for any single use case. Examples include large language models like GPT or Claude.
help_text.QGPAI_2: High-impact capabilities typically include: very large parameter counts (e.g., >10 billion), exceptional performance across diverse benchmarks, or capabilities that could have significant societal impact.
help_text.QAIS_5: These practices are completely prohibited under Article 5 of the AI Act. If your system performs any of these functions, it cannot be placed on the market or used in the EU.
help_text.QAIS_6_4: High-risk areas are defined in Annex III of the AI Act. Systems in these areas are subject to strict requirements including conformity assessment before market placement.
